org.dyn4j.collision.narrowphase

Interface NarrowphaseDetector

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FallbackNarrowphaseDetector, Gjk, Sat

    public interface NarrowphaseDetector
    Represents an algorithm to detect whether two Convex Shapes are penetrating/overlapping each other.

    If the Convex Shapes are penetrating/overlapping one another, the algorithm must determine the penetration axis of minimum depth and the depth of the penetration.

    All NarrowphaseDetectors are only required to perform tests on Convex Shapes. Doing so allows for faster and simpler code. Concave objects can also be supported by performing a convex decomposition.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.3
    Author:
    William Bittle

      Methods

      boolean detect(Convex convex1, Transform transform1, Convex convex2, Transform transform2)
      Returns true if the two Convex Shapes intersect.
      boolean detect(Convex convex1, Transform transform1, Convex convex2, Transform transform2, Penetration penetration)
      Returns true if the two Convex Shapes intersect and fills the Penetration object with the penetration vector and depth.

      • detect

        boolean detect(Convex convex1,
             Transform transform1,
             Convex convex2,
             Transform transform2)
        Returns true if the two Convex Shapes intersect.

        Used to quickly test if two Convex Shapes intersect without incurring the cost of determining Penetration.

        Parameters:
        convex1 - the first Convex Shape
        transform1 - the first Shape's Transform
        convex2 - the second Convex Shape
        transform2 - the second Shape's Transform
        Returns:
        boolean
